title: eTrade login
content: I have been using Firefox on my HP laptop for about 2 to 3 years. The current version is 130.0 which auto downloaded about a week or 2 ago. Now I am unable to login to my eTrade account unless I remove cache. The URL for the site is https://us.etrade.com/home/welcome-back. When I first click it, a tab pops up which is labeled Investing, Trading and Retirement with a dot on that tab that continues moving left to right to indicate it's trying to bring up the login page. It never times out. I noticed while it's doing that, there is verbiage down on the bottom left corner of the screen that says "Read c.evidon.com" which never goes away. If I go to Firefox settings and delete cache, the login screen will pop up after I restart Firefox. So I can end up logging in, but once I logout of eTrade and try to come back in, the same problem occurs. Never had this issue before but now is somewhat of a pain every time I need to get to my eTrade account. I also have Brave on my laptop and I don't have that issue when using it.

title: Housemaid Services in Abu Dhabi: A Quick Serve Solution
content: Abu Dhabi, the capital city of the United Arab Emirates (UAE), is known for its luxurious lifestyle, towering skyscrapers, and fast-paced urban living. As the city continues to grow, the demand for reliable domestic help services, especially housemaids, has seen a significant increase. For many residents, having a housemaid is not just a convenience but a necessity that enables them to balance their work and family life effectively. This is where Quick Serve, a prominent service provider, comes into play, offering an array of housemaid services tailored to meet the diverse needs of housemaids in Abu Dhabi . The Growing Need for Housemaids in Abu Dhabi In a bustling metropolis like Abu Dhabi, where many expatriates and locals lead hectic professional lives, finding time to manage household chores can be challenging. Many families, especially those with young children or elderly members, require dedicated help to ensure a smooth day-to-day routine. Additionally, the hot climate of Abu Dhabi necessitates frequent cleaning and maintenance, further amplifying the need for a reliable housemaid. The increasing number of working couples, coupled with high standards of living, has led to a significant demand for housemaids in Abu Dhabi. Housemaids are often tasked with a variety of responsibilities, ranging from cleaning and laundry to childcare and meal preparation. This variety of duties makes it essential to have skilled and trustworthy help. Quick Serve: Meeting the Demand with Excellence Quick Serve has emerged as a reliable solution for residents seeking professional and efficient housemaid services. Understanding the unique requirements of the city's diverse population, Quick Serve offers a range of tailored services designed to provide maximum convenience and satisfaction to its clients. Flexible Service Options: One of the key features of Quick Serve is its flexibility. It offers both full-time and part-time maid services, allowing clients to choose a service that best fits their needs and schedules. Whether it’s a one-time deep cleaning, regular weekly maintenance, or a long-term contract, Quick Serve has options to accommodate every household’s requirements. Trained and Vetted Staff: Quick Serve prides itself on employing trained and vetted housemaids who are skilled in various aspects of domestic work. The company ensures that its staff undergoes rigorous background checks and training programs, which include customer service, hygiene standards, and specialized cleaning techniques. This commitment to quality and security gives clients peace of mind, knowing that their homes are in safe hands. Customer-Centric Approach: At the heart of Quick Serve’s business model is a customer-centric approach. The company emphasizes transparency, reliability, and personalized service. Clients can easily book a housemaid online or through a simple phone call, and the service is tailored to match their specific needs. Quick Serve also offers customer support to address any concerns or special requests, ensuring a seamless experience. Affordable Pricing: Despite its high standards of service, Quick Serve is committed to providing affordable pricing options. The company offers competitive rates without compromising on quality, making professional housemaid services accessible to a broader audience in Abu Dhabi. They provide detailed pricing plans, allowing clients to make informed decisions based on their budgets. Why Choose Quick Serve? Choosing Quick Serve for housemaid services in Abu Dhabi comes with several benefits. First, it saves time and effort for residents who may otherwise struggle to find reliable help. Second, it eliminates the hassles associated with directly hiring a maid, such as conducting interviews, handling paperwork, and dealing with labor laws and regulations. Quick Serve handles all these aspects, providing a hassle-free solution for clients. Moreover, Quick Serve understands the cultural nuances and expectations of both local Emiratis and expatriates, offering services that respect these differences. This sensitivity ensures that all clients receive services that are not only professional but also culturally appropriate. Conclusion In a city like Abu Dhabi, where convenience and efficiency are highly valued, Quick Serve stands out as a trusted provider of housemaid services. By offering flexible, reliable, and affordable solutions, Quick Serve ensures that residents can enjoy a clean and well-maintained home without the stress and time commitment of managing domestic chores on their own. Whether it’s a busy professional couple, a family with young children, or an elderly person needing extra assistance, Quick Serve caters to all with its customer-focused approach. As the demand for housemaids in Abu Dhabi continues to grow, Quick Serve remains committed to providing top-notch service, making everyday life easier and more enjoyable for its clients.

title: Can't configure Firefox to not ask for physical security key instead of using PW mgr extension
content:
I have a problem where Firefox is asking for a physical security key when I log into certain sites. I do have passkeys saved in my password manager, but Firefox wants to intercept this request rather than passing it to my password manager extension. If this behavior is configurable, I don't know how to change the setting. It's not evident by looking in Settings

This functionality works correctly in Chrome/Chromium and Edge, on Windows and Linux, when I go to a site that I have a passkey saved in my password manager, the browser passes it to my password manager extension and I can log in that way. On Firefox, I have to press the "Try another way" link and enter my old school password and then a MFA additional factor.

Is it possible to configure Firefox to not try to respond to passkey requests and let the password manager extension handle it?

title: Unable to sync website data with Firefox that Chrome has no issue with

At the request of Draftsharks support, I used Chrome to try the same thing, and there were no issues in Chrome connecting Draftsharks to ESPN and performing a live sync. In Firefox settings, I put ESPN in the "Manage Exceptions" area, but it still didn't work when trying to sync Draftsharks with ESPN.
creator: doozybird@icloud.com

title: Resource Bottleneck
content:
Greetings, Firefox requires a huge amount of memory (and other associated resources), and each tab consumes much resources. The resource consumption is a big problem when a few tabs are needed to support research projects. How about spending more time improving the resource utilization as opposed to developing features? The resource utilization of Firefox is poor when compared to other browsers like Brave. However, I like Firefox the best from a features standpoint. So how about it? Please put some effort into making Firefox more resource friendly. One way to get free improvement is to immediately release resources for objects that are orphaned because the associated application has been closed. Lingering resources are a complete waste.

Thanks, Dan

title: Firefox ESR: Firefox translate not offered
content:

I'm at work right now on ESR 115.15.0 / Windows 10 64-bit and no translate icon appears on the address bar when checking German or French or Japanese sites (for example). Comparing my own browser settings to another, non-ESR FF it seems that on ESR something is missing. There is only a reference "Firefox Translations" and a "Exceptions" button to it. Can't tell if this is a bug or a feature (ie ESR lacks Firefox translate).

creator: fits79

title: Mozilla, please consider allowing some form of WebUSB, even if only for "Firefox Developer Edition".
content:
Regarding the current state of Firefox and WebUSB, I have four thoughts:

  1. Yes, Mozilla's concerns regarding the security risks are valid, but not insurmountable.
  2. In my experience, this is the single W3C noncompliance that impedes my use of Firefox.
  3. In my experience, an increasing number of companies/organizations are leveraging WebUSB, from core-functionality of end-user hardware to enterprise-level troubleshooting, configuration, and support.
  4. If Mozilla permits the use of unsigned plugins for its Firefox Developer Edition because of the reasonable expectation that its users understand the risks, it stands to reason that the same could be said for WebUSB.

(There's no need to reply, really - this is only being publicly posted because there doesn't seem to be a way to do otherwise - I just wanted to go through the exercise of casting this message-in-a-bottle into the sea.)
creator: Indigo

title: Default Bookmark Folder
content:
When I right click a tab and select Bookmark Tab, the "Location" is preselected from one of my existing bookmark folders/locations. I thought it might adapt to the most recent or most often selected folder; however, it seems to present the same "default" location every time I bookmark a tab - a folder I have not barely used in months. I realize I can select another folder, but it is annoying for it to select the LEAST used and my personal least favorite folder EVERY TIME, for MONTHS.

1) Is there a way to select which folder it preloads to save bookmarks to? 2) Why is it selecting THAT folder? 3) If there is no way to set a folder, is there a way to reset it or something? ANY other folder to default to would be less annoying. I do not understand why it seems "stuck" on this folder and will not preload ANY other folder from the dozens of folders.

Thanks in advance for any help!
creator: ameliajaycen
